org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game

Class BigStepSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractControllableAlgorithm
        • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game.AbstractControllableGameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>
          • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game.BigStepSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener, ControllableGameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>, GameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>, ControllableAlgorithm

    public class BigStepSolver
extends AbstractControllableGameSolver<MemorylessStrategy>
    This class provides an implementation of the big step solver for parity games in [Sven Schewe: Solving Parity Games in Big Steps. FSTTCS 2007: 449-460].
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BigStepSolver.ApproximateProgressMeasure
      This class provides an approximated progress measure.
      static class  BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple
      This class provides an approximated tuple.

      WinningPair<MemorylessStrategy> approximate(Game game, StateSet subgame, GamePlayer player, int ds)

      Returns a solution of a subgame of a specified game.
      MemorylessSolution winningRegions(Game game, StateSet subgame)
      This method corresponds to the procedure Winning-Regions in the paper except that for 3-color subgames, this method computes the strategies for both players immediately.

    • Method Detail

      • approximate

        public WinningPair<MemorylessStrategy> approximate(Game game,
                                                   StateSet subgame,
                                                   GamePlayer player,
                                                   int ds)
        This method corresponds to the procedure approximate in the paper.
        Parameters:
        game - a parity game
        subgame - the states of a subgame in the parity game
        player - the game player which the solver is going to solve the parity game for
        ds - the maximum sum of tuples in a progress measure
        Returns:
        the solution for the specified player in the subgame

      • winningRegions

        public MemorylessSolution winningRegions(Game game,
                                         StateSet subgame)
        This method corresponds to the procedure Winning-Regions in the paper except that for 3-color subgames, this method computes the strategies for both players immediately.
        Parameters:
        game - a parity game
        subgame - the states of a subgame of the game
        Returns:
        the solution of the subgame

      • isApplicable

        public boolean isApplicable(Game g)
        Description copied from interface: GameSolver
        Returns true if the specified game is supported by this solver.
        Parameters:
        g - a game
        Returns:
        true if the specified game is supported by this solver

      • solve

        public MemorylessSolution solve(Game game,
                                StateSet subgame)
                         throws UnsupportedException
        Description copied from interface: GameSolver
        Returns a solution of a subgame of a specified game.
        Parameters:
        game - a game
        subgame - the states of the subgame in the game
        Returns:
        a solution of the specified game
        Throws:
        UnsupportedException - if the game is not supported by this solver
